title: Java Mathtanh()Method

metadata.description: Learn about Java Mathtanh()Method with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example
Return the hyperbolic tangent of different numbers:
System.out.println(Math.tanh(3));
System.out.println(Math.tanh(-3));
System.out.println(Math.tanh(0));
System.out.println(Math.tanh(1));

Definition and Usage
The
tanh()
method returns the hyperbolic tangent of a number.
The hyperbolic tangent is equivalent to
Math.sinh(number) / Math.cosh(number)
.
Syntax
public static double tanh(double
number
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
number
Required. A number to find the hyperbolic tangent of.
Technical Details
Returns:
A
double
value representing the hyperbolic tangent of a number.
Java version:
1.5+

★
+1

summary: This tutorial covers Java Mathtanh()Method concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use Java Mathtanh()Method effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of Java Mathtanh()Method and how to apply it in your projects.
